definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: These landforms were dubbed tiankeng, or "naturally formed pits".
sentences.chinese: 這些地貌現象被稱作天坑，或者“自然形成的坑洞”。

sentences.english: The course is tight enough with well-bunkered holes to trouble the most accomplished golfer when the wind blows.
sentences.chinese: 沙坑洞在風起時足以爲最富經驗的選手製造麻煩。

sentences.english: Repair potholes in driveways and private roads.
sentences.chinese: 修復坑洞在車道和私家道路。

sentences.english: Fill the pot-holes and shore up the bridges on the roads we have.
sentences.chinese: 填上坑洞，加固支撐現有道路的橋樑。

sentences.english: The little bridge had holes in it and you had to walk rather carefully.
sentences.chinese: 小橋上坑坑洞洞，你得特別小心地走過去。

sentences.english: The ground has been pitted by the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 地面被爆炸弄成坑坑洞洞。

sentences.english: The district is pock-marked with caves.
The idea that Lake Cheko might fill an impact crater became more attractive to us.
sentences.chinese: 契科湖可能是撞擊坑洞的構想對我們更具吸引力。

definition: Shenkeng township in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
Dongkou county in Shaoyang 邵陽|邵阳[Shao4 yang2], Hunan
crushed or broken rock, stone etc
so deep one cannot see to the bottom/limitless
